Project based on the 
[Computational Molecular Science Python Cookiecutter](https://github.com/molssi/cookiecutter-cms) version 1.1.


[^1]:  Wieder, M., Fleck, M., Braunsfeld, B., Boresch, S., *J. Comput. Chem.* 2022, 1. [DOI](https://doi.org/10.1002/jcc.26877)
[^2]:  Karwounopoulos, J.,Kaupang, A., Wieder, M., Boresch, S., *JCTC* 2023, 9, 954638 [DOI](https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jctc.3c00691)
[^3]:  Karwounopoulos, J., Wieder, M., Boresch, S., *Front. Mol. Biosci.* 2022, 9, 954638 [DOI](https://doi.org/10.3389/fmolb.2022.954638
)

# How to contribute

We welcome contributions from external contributors, and this document
describes how to merge code changes into this transformato. 

## Getting Started

* Make sure you have a [GitHub account](https://github.com/signup/free).
* [Fork](https://help.github.com/articles/fork-a-repo/) this repository on GitHub.
* On your local machine,
  [clone](https://help.github.com/articles/cloning-a-repository/) your fork of
  the repository.

## Making Changes

* Add some really awesome code to your local fork.  It's usually a [good
  idea](http://blog.jasonmeridth.com/posts/do-not-issue-pull-requests-from-your-master-branch/)
  to make changes on a
  [branch](https://help.github.com/articles/creating-and-deleting-branches-within-your-repository/)
  with the branch name relating to the feature you are going to add.
* When you are ready for others to examine and comment on your new feature,
  navigate to your fork of transformato on GitHub and open a [pull
  request](https://help.github.com/articles/using-pull-requests/) (PR). Note that
  after you launch a PR from one of your fork's branches, all
  subsequent commits to that branch will be added to the open pull request
  automatically.  Each commit added to the PR will be validated for
  mergability, compilation and test suite compliance; the results of these tests
  will be visible on the PR page.
* If you're providing a new feature, you must add test cases and documentation.
* When the code is ready to go, make sure you run the test suite using pytest.
* When you're ready to be considered for merging, check the "Ready to go"
  box on the PR page to let the transformato devs know that the changes are complete.
  The code will not be merged until this box is checked, the continuous
  integration returns checkmarks,
  and multiple core developers give "Approved" reviews.

# Additional Resources

* [General GitHub documentation](https://help.github.com/)
* [PR best practices](http://codeinthehole.com/writing/pull-requests-and-other-good-practices-for-teams-using-github/)
* [A guide to contributing to software packages](http://www.contribution-guide.org)
* [Thinkful PR example](http://www.thinkful.com/learn/github-pull-request-tutorial/#Time-to-Submit-Your-First-PR)
Set up relative free energy calculations using a common scaffold

Transformato is a package that helps to set up relative alchemical free energy calculations of small molecules with a common core scaffold, either for relative solvation free energy[^1], absolute solvation free energy[^2] or binding free energy[^3] estimates. The package is designed to be used with output generated by [CHARMM-GUI](https://charmm-gui.org/).

{: .note .info}
This information applies to versions in development. For a stable experience, use the original version at wiederm/transformato

# Installation
## Prerequisites
- A working version of [conda/miniconda](https://docs.conda.io/en/latest/)
- A working version of git
- A somewhat recent version of python
- A CUDA - capable device (locally or node). A CUDA device is not required to generate the intermediate states, but one is required to do simulations or analysises.

## Getting transformato

The following assumes the use of a bash shell:

```bash
cd /directory/you/want/transformato/in
git clone https://github.com/JohannesKarwou/transformato.git # if you don't depend on features in development here - use the main repo
```
This should download transformato. Afterwards, do:
```bash
cd transformato
python setup.py install
```
which will register transformato with conda, create an environment called `fep`, and install dependencies.
Now go to the environment `fep`:
```bash
conda activate fep
```

Now, run a python script:

```python
import transformato
print(transformato.__version__)
```
If you output the current transformato version, then congratulations! You are now ready to use transformato.

transformato can be easily installed from conda-forge:
```
conda install transformato -c conda-forge
```

result.description:
## What's Changed
* documentation link by @florianjoerg in https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/pull/120
* update python version by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/pull/119
* Avoid importing tf_routes by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/pull/118
* Update analysis.py by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/pull/121
* Another cleanup by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/pull/122

## New Contributors
* @florianjoerg made their first contribution in https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/pull/120

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/cbc-univie/transformato/compare/v0.4...v0.5
result.name: v0.5

result.description:
## What's Changed
* Create label.yml by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/91
* Include Black formatting in GH by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/92
* save endstate results as pickle by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/95
* integrate ASFE into the main mutation.py file by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/90
* create conda package for transformato by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/93
* improving charmm domdec support by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/94
* update the handling of lp to the current parmed version by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/89
* improving usability by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/96
* Fixing minor problems with some GH actions by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/99
* No multiple restraints on atom & switch to single topology for restraint generation by @agrass15268 in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/104
* Remove irritating name by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/101
* updated parmed by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/111
* new find_mcs function for exclusion of hydrogens by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/110
* adapting name for checking torison atoms by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/112
* adapt some packages by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/117


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/compare/v0.3...v0.4
result.name: v0.4

result.description:
transformato can now be used together with the endstate corrections package (https://github.com/wiederm/endstate_correction) for correcting `asfe`.

## What's Changed
* updated overview figure by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/79
* Potential shapes by @agrass15268 in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/80
* **read in str** files by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/81
* Update .gitattributes by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/83
* pin version of pymbar by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/86
* Merging dev_doc into main by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/87
* Create warning for overlap by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/82
* **absolute solvation** by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/75
* integrating **endstate corrections** into TF by @JohannesKarwou in https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/pull/88


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/wiederm/transformato/compare/v0.2...v0.3
